content:
5.17. 
Disputing a will
1. An action for the annulment of a will or of parts of a will may be brought only by the other heirs at law or under the will who would inherit if the will or the parts of the will were annulled.
2. The invalidity of a subsequent will shall not invalidate the earlier will, unless the invalidity of the subsequent will is based on the fact that it was made under duress or real threat or by a person declared by a court to be incapacitated in this field or to have limited capacity in this field.
